question.title: I can't add GoogleMap on Vaadin
question.body:
I am doing an assignment where we have to add Google Maps to a web interface using Vaadin.

This is the relevant pom.xml part:

<repositories>
        <repository>
            <id>flowingcode</id>
            <url>https://maven.flowingcode.com/artifactory/flowingcode-repo</url>
        </repository>
        <repository>
            <id>Vaadin Directory</id>
            <url>https://maven.vaadin.com/vaadin-addons</url>
            <snapshots>
                <enabled>false</enabled>
            </snapshots>
        </repository>
    </repositories>

[...]
<dependencies>
        [vaadin default dependencies...]

        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.flowingcode.vaadin.addons</groupId>
            <artifactId>googlemaps</artifactId>
            <version>2.1.1</version> //older version on purpose to try it out
        </dependency>
    </dependencies>

My teacher said that we have to do Alt+Enter -> Add Maven Dependency -> GoogleMap, but nothing appears. I tried to add the dependency manually on the pom.xml, but it's not working. The redirecting links in the terminal errors are all 404s and 403s. What can i do?

answers.body:
Just remove the repository. You don't need that.

<repository>
   <id>flowingcode</id>
   <url>https://maven.flowingcode.com/artifactory/flowingcode-repo</url>
</repository>

question_comments.body: Then please be more specific about what "does not work". Add the errors you get etc.
Have you tried using the repo from the docs? github.com/FlowingCode/…
